page.title: 16MARKET RASEN MARKET PLACE
page.content: The market began in about 1220 and up until the 20th. century the agricultural nature of the area dictated the flavour of the market. In the 15th. and 16th. centuries sheep dominated proceedings. The market naturally attracted other trade including the sale of hides and travelling tailors tinkers etc. In the 20th. century the nature of the market has become more general as social habits and prosperity have altered. The Market Place itself retains much of its character although the town hall and pump were removed (the latter is to restored to its former position) A covered area next to the church provides produce auction facilities each Tuesday and other stalls are also present.The Market Place-the focus of the town.The livestock market is next to the rly.station(Wed.)mostly sheep.
